Module hanyaeger.api
Package com.github.hanyaeger.api.engine

Class YaegerGame

java.lang.Object
javafx.application.Application
com.github.hanyaeger.api.engine.YaegerGame
public abstract class YaegerGame
extends javafx.application.Application
YaegerGame is the base class that must be extended to create a Yaeger game. After extending this class, two lifecycle methods will become available: setupGame() and setupScenes(). The methods should be used for any further configuration.

The constructor of the extending class should be the default empty constructor. Furthermore, the extending class should have a main-method that should look as follows: 


      public static void main(String[] args) {
          launch(args);
      }

    • DEFAULT_GAME_DIMENSIONS

      public static final Size DEFAULT_GAME_DIMENSIONS
      As an ode to the old days, the default dimensions of a Yaeger Game is 640x480px.

  • Method Details

    • setActiveScene

      public void setActiveScene​(int id)
      Set the current active YaegerScene.
      Parameters:
      id - the Integer identifying the YaegerScene

    • quit

      public void quit()
      Stop and close the Game.

    • setSize

      protected void setSize​(Size size)
      Set the Size, being the width and height of the game.
      Parameters:
      size - a Size object that encapsulates the width and height of the game

    • setGameTitle

      protected void setGameTitle​(java.lang.String title)
      Set the title of the Game.
      Parameters:
      title - a String containing the title of the Game

    • addScene

      protected void addScene​(int id, YaegerScene scene)
      Add a YaegerScene to the Game.
      Parameters:
      id - the Integer identifying the YaegerScene
      scene - the YaegerScene that should be added

    • setupGame

      protected abstract void setupGame()
      Use this method to setup the Game. The following methods are available:
      • setSize(Size)
      • setGameTitle(String)

    • setupScenes

      protected abstract void setupScenes()
      Use this method to add the instances of YaegerScene that make up the Game. A YaegerScene will usually either be a level, a welcome-screen, an intro-screen or a game-over screen, for instance.

      To create a YaegerScene extend either a StaticScene or a DynamicScene. A StaticScene should be used for simple screens that do not need the Game world Update cycle. If such an cycle is required, extend a DynamicScene.

    • start

      public void start​(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
      Specified by:
      start in class javafx.application.Application
